project.teaser: Cardea is the Roman Goddess of door pivots, ideal to describe our project to develop Research Managers (RM) who strengthen Europe's R&I excellence through a diverse set of support roles and responsibilities. Research Management as a profession is almost invisible from policy...
project.objective: Cardea is the Roman Goddess of door pivots, ideal to describe our project to develop Research Managers (RM) who strengthen Europe's R&I excellence through a diverse set of support roles and responsibilities. Research Management as a profession is almost invisible from policy, career progression and tenure opportunities across Europe. Also, there is little consistency between countries, funders, policymakers and individual institutions. Cardea will develop supports to address this inequality. Our consortium has enjoyed considerable success doing this for Researchers already. We will create a detailed data-driven (500+ participants, 24 countries) knowledge space-defining and characterising the problem. Based on this, we will develop a range of solutions, including a Capacity Maturity Model to assess and improve RM activities, a novel RM Hub for networking and training to include a community of practice. Equality, Diversity and Inclusion, Widening Participation (EU13), Public-Private partnership actions will be at the core of our research, training and enhancement activities. Additionally, the mobility and networking of RM and those with responsibility for developing RMs will be included to ensure the RM ecosystem grows transnationally. We will learn from each other and support one another in bringing RM careers to the next level. Significantly these actions will provide a significant evidence base to advocate the inclusion of RM exigences in policy, and we will target this proactively, targeting 38 key decision making organisations. Amongst the impacts of Cardea will be an enduring network and Hub that can facilitate RM development and collaboration, a validated methodology to assess RM careers and a well-established baseline against which improvements can be objectively measured. This allows us to develop an RM Charter and offer a Concordat to institutions and organisations that make significant commitments to developing RM activities in a structured, mature manner.
project.title: CARDEA - Career Acknowledgement for Research (Managers) Delivering for the European Area

result.title: Consortium mobility and collaboration report - interim report
result.description: Report on the intra-Cardea mobility and networking feeding into the advocacy and influencing WP8. This initial report will detail the activities to date within and between the Cardea partners in the space of mobility, networking and collaboration. To include updated plans for and reports on:8 study visits (international)14 public private fact finding visits38 meetings of Science fundingExploration of opportunities for teaming and twinning with EU projectsExploration of intra-Cardea collaborative learning through trainings/seminars

result.title: Community of Practice - report 1
result.description: The community of practice is the structure that allows managers of research managers to collaborate consult with each others and promote effective management and governance of research manager careers across Europe This report will detail the initial Community of practice plan for managers of research managers It will includeCoPHub work planCoPHub Charter organisation and strategy CoP Hub activities including case studies fact sheetsNote that this work will be closely integrated with ERAHUb

result.title: Updated methodology playbook
result.description: The updated methodology playbook will build on the initial report by refinding any chanced to experiential methodologies for Cardea research.The report will detail the validated research methodology for all Cardea research activities to include the questionnaires, interview schedules, data analysis plan, literature review, research questions.It will also contain cross references to location and accessibility of raw data.

result.title: Training Caralogue - Mid Term Update
result.description: Report updating the existing training ecosystem for research managers, integrating courses, modules and trainings that exist already or have been developed by month 30 in Cardea (and other accessible programmes).

result.title: Continuing Professional Development Model - Initial framework
result.description: This report details the initial model framework for a structured approach to characterization and delivery of bespoke Research Manager continuing professional development. It will integrate the outputs of the needs analysis (from WP2), networking (WP4), Hub learning (WP3) as well as deliver compatibility with the the Skills Agenda for work (Action 5) and the ESCO European Skills, Competencies, Qualifications and Occupations nomenclature. The work will deliver a model to give clarity to the skills, knowledge, abilities, qualifications, and occupational characteristics of research managers.

result.title: Initial Cardea Toolkit report
result.description: Cardea will produce a number of guides/frameworks. Taken together these will become the Cardea toolkit and will include:Research report on data analysis outputs and conclusionsAnalysis of gap between current provision and RM needsCapability Maturity ModelKnowledge, Skills, Abilities self assessment toolTraining Needs Analysis guided assessment tool (individual and organisational levels)Professional Development Plan for Research Managers templateResearch Manager Competency Model (with specialised sub models for specific roles)The contents of each framework, tool, and template will be reported in the toolkit reports.

result.title: Initial methodology playbook
result.description: Initial methodology playbook outlining experiential methodologies for Cardea researchThe report will detail the validated research methodology for all Cardea research activities to include the questionnaires interview schedules data analysis plan literature review research questions

result.title: Institutional KPIs interim report
result.description: Institutional KPIs interim report - Task 8.1 KPIs for Institutions RM capacity

result.title: Initial Engagement Report
result.description: Initial Engagement Report - Task 8.1 Identification of RMs

result.title: Research Managers Networking and Mobility - Initial Report
result.description: Initial report on the understanding of the state of play of Research Manager networking and mobility activities (results of mapping exercise)Report systematically detailing the networking and mobility patterns and activities of Research Managers based on data analysis from WP2. To also include report on usage statistics for international, inter-role and inter-sectional matchmaking and discussion forums from Hub activities in WP3.

result.title: Project Management Plan (update)
result.description: The initial Project Management will be updated to reflect the development of the project operational aspects and to provide an initial plan for the project sustainability. Project management plan with roadmap and implementation plan for all aspects of project: to include the following subsidiary plansScope statementOrganisational structures (including governance and specialisation groups)Work plan and timelines (including meeting schedule)Monitoring and control planChange management planRisk Management planStakeholder management planSustainability plan (future planning)Governance Committee reports and activities

result.title: Widening Research Managers Careers Code of Conduct - draft
result.description: Draft Code of Conduct framework prepared for external consultation. Providing initial guidelines to support organisations in realising the requirement of the charter and preparing to sign concordant. This will compliment the wider Commission work on a general Code of Conduct for Research Managers.

result.title: Equality, Diversity and Inclusion - Interim Report
result.description: Interim report outlining progress on current understanding, development of tools and information for all dimensions of equality, diversity and inclusion relevant to research managers. To include updates on Data driven RM EDI profiles (national, institutional)Policy recommendationsFact sheetsTemplate (checklist) to support local EDI development activitiesTransition support programmePilot coaching and mentoring programmeEDI awareness training modules

result.description: The initial plan will lay out the communication plan for all Cardea activities It will be integrated with the other project management plans in WP1 but is distinct in that it details all the opportunities for engagement and exploitation of the project activities Specifically he Communication Plan Strategy and Activities will include sections onGoals and objectivesTarget audiencesScientific publicationsCapacity building including human capital expertiseMetrics and KPIS for exploitationWebsiteLearning environmentFact sheetsTraining offeringsPresentations by Cardea membersWorkshopsSocial media activitiesPress coverageNewslettersPeer reviewed publications

result.title: Initial Researach Manager Mapping Summary Report.
result.description: Summary report of Resource mapping of dedicated Research Manager Opportunities and Gaps Identified. This summary will report on the the results of the mapping activities looking at all the policiesCurrent TrainingMobility opportunitiesFunding opportunitiesand Networking opportunities that are available (or absent relative to other sectors of the research and innovation ecosystem). This will draw on the activities of EURAXESS through a Research Manager lens and identify gaps in the current offerings available to research managers.

result.title: Widening Public-Private engagement - Initial Report
result.description: This report will detail the conversations and collaborations that have been completed between Higher Education Institutions and Private Industry to develop linkages, collaborations and opportunities to support research managers transitioning between sectors.To include:MOUsReports on consultationsCase studiesFuture opportunity identificationReport on the learning from the widening activities workshop, mentoring etcDetailed plan for Innovation/ Transitions Summer School.

result.title: Updated Communication Plan: Strategy and Activities
result.description: The updated plan will lay out the evolution of the the communication plan for all Cardea activities by the middle of the project. It will be integrated with the other project management plans in WP1 but is distinct in that it details all the opportunities for engagement and exploitation of the project activities and what has been achieved to date. Specifically he Communication Plan: Strategy and Activities will include sections on-Goals and objectives-Target audiences - and engagement with same to date-Scientific publications-Capacity building (including human capital expertise)-Metrics and KPIS for exploitation-Website-Learning environment-Fact sheets-Training offerings-Presentations by Cardea members-Workshops-Social media activities-Press coverage-Newsletters-Peer reviewed publications

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
